meanings.sent1: The apple was so crisp, it made a satisfying sound when I bit into it.
meanings.sent2: The lettuce in the salad was crisp and crunchy.
meanings.sent3: The crisp breeze outside made me shiver, but it felt refreshing.
meanings.sent4: Her crisp voice cut through the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The crisp morning air filled my lungs with energy.

meanings.definition: (verb) make something firm and fresh by heating it
meanings.sent1: She knew how to crisp the bread just right in the toaster.
meanings.sent2: The chef will crisp the skin of the duck by roasting it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally left the cookies in the oven too long, and they crisped up more than I wanted.
meanings.sent4: The sun will crisp the leaves on the trees during the hot summer days.
meanings.sent5: The fire crisped the marshmallows to perfection for s'mores.

meanings.definition: (noun) a thin slice of potato fried until crisp
meanings.sent1: I love snacking on a handful of crisps while watching a movie.
meanings.sent2: The bag of crisps was almost empty because they were so delicious.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't resist the temptation of the salty crisps on the table.
meanings.sent4: The crisps in the bowl were the perfect accompaniment to the cold drinks.
meanings.sent5: The golden crisps were a hit at the party, disappearing quickly.
